metadata.synopsis: In the early 17th century, innocent young Persephone is falsely accused and put on trial for her life. Her fate seems sealed except for the timely intervention of the mysterious Reverend Mother offering her not just sanctuary, but hope. The Reverend Mother is the leader of a small religious retreat where her fellow Sisters seek atonement for their pasts. But upon arrival, Persephone is plagued with visions and soon realizes that it's not salvation that awaits but a battle for her very soul.

reviews: Bad entertainment because the film doesn't bring up any real questioning. [Full Review in Spanish]
Turns profane raw materials into a lackluster array of stock horror drivel.
Hyett proves more successful with atmosphere than plot.
Not that scary, but a game cast and a production team that punches WAY above its budget really lift this spooky period piece.
